issues.title: Sidebar folders don't expand when navigating via prev/next footer links
issues.body:
## Description

When navigating between pages using the prev/next footer navigation, sidebar folders don't expand to show the active page. The folder remains collapsed even though the page inside it is now active.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Have a docs structure with folders (e.g., API Reference with nested pages)
2. Be on a page outside the folder (e.g., "API Introduction")
3. Click "Next" in the footer to navigate to a page inside the folder
4. Observe the sidebar - the folder remains collapsed

## Expected Behavior

The folder containing the newly active page should automatically expand to show the active page in the sidebar.

## Root Cause Analysis

After investigating the source code, I believe the issue is in `packages/ui/src/components/sidebar/page-tree.tsx`:

```javascript
return useMemo(() => {
  function renderSidebarList(items) {
    return items.map((item, i) => {
      // ...
      if (item.type === "folder") return <Folder item={item} children={...} key={i} />
    })
  }
  return <Fragment>{renderSidebarList(root.children)}</Fragment>
}, [Folder, Item, Separator, root]);  // ← path is NOT a dependency
```

The `useMemo` dependencies don't include `path` (from `useTreePath()`). When navigation occurs:

1. `pathname` changes → `TreeContextProvider` recomputes `path`
2. `SidebarPageTree` re-renders
3. But `useMemo` dependencies (`Folder`, `Item`, `Separator`, `root`) haven't changed
4. **Same JSX object reference is returned**
5. React sees same reference → skips re-rendering child `PageTreeFolder` components
6. `PageTreeFolder` never re-executes → `useTreePath()` inside it is never called again
7. `active` prop to `SidebarFolder` never updates
8. Folder stays collapsed

## Environment

- fumadocs-core: 16.4.7
- fumadocs-ui: 16.4.7
- fumadocs-openapi: 10.2.4
- Next.js: 16.1.1
- React: 19.2.3

## Related

This appears similar to #2876 (TanStack Router navigation bug) but affects Next.js with the standard prev/next footer navigation.

## Potential Fix

The `useMemo` in `SidebarPageTree` needs to either:
1. Include `path` in dependencies (though this would recreate the entire tree on navigation)
2. Use a different pattern where folders subscribe to path changes individually
3. Remove the memoization and let React's normal reconciliation handle it

issues.title: Optimize server bundle for cloudflare workers when using openapi
issues.body:
### What problem will this feature address?

A blank fumadocs project with openapi integration, when deployed to cloudflare workers with opennext, has a server bundle that gets uploaded of about 3.5mb. This is over the cloudflare free tier limit of 3mb (I'm a cheapskate). The cause for the somewhat large size is that the full shiki bundle with all languages and themes is included. I wasn't sure if this counted as a bug since nothing is functionally broken.

I tried set the languages and themes for rehype in `mdxOptions`. However this had no effect. This problem is specific to the openapi support with `ApiPage`. 

### Describe the solution you'd like

Ability to configure the `ApiPage` with a subset of shiki themes and languages. Only these themes and languages will be included in the server bundle. aka (`.open-next/server-functions/default/handler.mjs.meta.json`) for open-next cloudflare.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Could reuse the configuration that is already possible within `mdxComponents` for shiki in rehype.

### Additional context

I got the latest version of fumadocs with openapi support running with cloudflare workers. I followed this https://github.com/fuma-nama/fumadocs/issues/2800 to get it working. When building/deploying with cloudflare, I was wondering why the server bundle was relatively big. 

Repro: https://github.com/ed-curran/fumadocs-cloudflare-example

The reason is that`.open-next/server-functions/default/handler.mjs.meta.json`. includes the full @shikijs bundle which is 9mb. It includes all the languages and themes. My understanding for why this happens is as follows (i may be mistaken):

1. happens when using the fumadocs openapi package and ApiPage component is included in `mdx-components`.
2. `DynamicCodeblock` gets used which is a client component. 
3. `DynamicCodeblock` eventually calls into `highlight/shiki.ts` which will dynamically import `shiki` with 
```
 const { createHighlighter } = await import('shiki');
```
This includes all the languages and themes. This is kind of necessary since arbitrary languages are supported, which can be configured in a few ways. However, i feel it should be possible for me to limit myself to only some languages and themes. In theory could be possible using the [https://shiki.style/guide/bundles#fine-grained-bundle]() approach. I had a go at implementing this but couldn't get it working.

issues.title: postinstall error in monorepo (probably zod v4 related)
issues.body:
### To Reproduce

I wanted to create a new documentation from scratch and tried both tanstack start and nextjs, both of them run into the following error when installing.

I followed the wizard to set it up and that worked.
```bash
❯ pnpm create fumadocs-app
...
┌  Create Fumadocs App
│
◇  Project name
│  documentation
│
◇  Choose a template
│  Next.js: Fumadocs MDX
│
◇  Use `/src` directory?
│  No
│
◇  Configure linter?
│  Biome
│
◇  Choose a search solution?
│  Default
│
◇  Do you want to install packages automatically? (detected as pnpm)
│  Yes
│
◇  Project Generated
│
└  Done


Open the project
cd documentation

Run Development Server
pnpm dev

You can now open the project and start writing documents
```

Surprisingly the dev command works but when I either try to install dependencies or build it, I get this error:


*install*
```
❯ pnpm --dir=web/apps/documentation install

apps/documentation postinstall$ fumadocs-mdx
│ file:///Users/chronark/github/unkeyed/unkey/web/node_modules/.pnpm/fumadocs-mdx@14.2.4_@types+react@19.2.7_fumadocs-core@16.4.3_next@16.1.1_react@19.…
│ TypeEr_openapi: z.looseObject({}).optional()
│ 	at            ^
│ TypeError: z.looseObject is not a function
│     at file:///Users/chronark/github/unkeyed/unkey/web/node_modules/.pnpm/fumadocs-mdx@14.2.4_@types+react@19.2.7_fumadocs-core@16.4.3_next@16.1.1_re…
│     at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:377:25)
│     at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:103:5)
│     at async onImport.tracePromise.__proto__ (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:671:26)
│     at async loadConfig (file:///Users/chronark/github/unkeyed/unkey/web/node_modules/.pnpm/fumadocs-mdx@14.2.4_@types+react@19.2.7_fumadocs-core@16.…
│     at async Object.init (file:///Users/chronark/github/unkeyed/unkey/web/node_modules/.pnpm/fumadocs-mdx@14.2.4_@types+react@19.2.7_fumadocs-core@16…
│     at async postInstall (file:///Users/chronark/github/unkeyed/unkey/web/node_modules/.pnpm/fumadocs-mdx@14.2.4_@types+react@19.2.7_fumadocs-core@16…
│     at async start (file:///Users/chronark/github/unkeyed/unkey/web/node_modules/.pnpm/fumadocs-mdx@14.2.4_@types+react@19.2.7_fumadocs-core@16.4.3_n…
│ Node.js v24.11.1
└─ Failed in 446ms at /Users/chronark/github/unkeyed/unkey/web/apps/documentation
 ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 1.

```

*build*

```
❯ pnpm --dir=web/apps/documentation build

> documentation@0.0.0 build /Users/chronark/github/unkeyed/unkey/web/apps/documentation
> next build

▲ Next.js 16.1.1 (Turbopack)

unhandledRejection TypeError: z.looseObject is not a function
    at ignore-listed frames
 ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 1.
```


___

full reproduction for us:
```
git clone https://github.com/unkeyed/unkey.git
cd unkey/web/apps
pnpm create fumadocs-app # accept all defaults
cd ..
pnpm install
```




### Current vs. Expected behavior


This must be some monorepo issue, cause it works in a fresh repo.
It's a long shot but maybe someone has already seen this and knows the solution.
My guess is that having both zod v3 and v4 required in the monorepo breaks something.



### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: darwin
  Arch: arm64
  Version: Darwin Kernel Version 24.6.0: Mon Aug 11 21:16:21 PDT 2025; root:xnu-11417.140.69.701.11~1/RELEASE_ARM64_T6000
  Available memory (MB): 32768
  Available CPU cores: 10
Binaries:
  Node: 24.11.1
  npm: 11.6.2
  Yarn: 1.22.22
  pnpm: 8.6.9
Relevant Packages:
  next: 16.1.1 // Latest available version is detected (16.1.1).
  eslint-config-next: N/A
  react: 19.2.3
  react-dom: 19.2.3
  typescript: N/A
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

CLI (create-fumadocs-app)

### Additional context

_No response_

issues.title: Performance issue with default "Math" configuration on pages with many formulas
issues.body:
### To Reproduce

1. Create a fresh project: `npm create fumadocs-app` (choose Next.js).
2. Follow the Math docs setup: https://www.fumadocs.dev/docs/ui/markdown/math.
3. Add a page with a table that includes ~15–20 LaTeX formulas, e.g. the sample below.
4. Open the page in dev or start mode — the page becomes extremely laggy.

Sample table:

``` mdx
| $t$ | State $s_t \in \mathbb{R}^D$                                                                                                                              | Output $y_t \in \mathbb{R}^D$   |
| --- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| 0   | $ s_0 = \frac{u \odot k_0 \odot v_0}{u \odot k_0} $                                                                                                       | $ y_0 = \sigma(r_0) \odot s_0 $ |
| 1   | $ s_1 = \frac{u \odot k_1 \odot v_1 + k_0 \odot v_0}{u \odot k_1 + k_0} $                                                                                 | $ y_1 = \sigma(r_1) \odot s_1 $ |
| 2   | $ s_2 = \frac{u \odot k_2 \odot v_2 + k_1 \odot v_1 + w \odot k_0 \odot v_0}{u \odot k_2 + k_1 + w \odot k_0} $                                           | $ y_2 = \sigma(r_2) \odot s_2 $ |
| 3   | $ s_3 = \frac{u \odot k_3 \odot v_3 + k_2 \odot v_2 + w \odot k_1 \odot v_1 + w^2 \odot k_0 \odot v_0}{u \odot k_3 + k_2 + w \odot k_1 + w^2 \odot k_0} $ | $ y_3 = \sigma(r_3) \odot s_3 $ |

| $t$ | State $s_t \in \mathbb{R}^{64 \times 64}$                                                                                                                  | Output $y_t \in \mathbb{R}^{64}$ |
| --- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
| 0   | $s_0 = \text{diag}(u) \cdot k_0^\top \cdot v_0$                                                                                                            | $y_0 = r_0 \cdot s_0$            |
| 1   | $s_1 = \text{diag}(u) \cdot k_1^\top \cdot v_1 + k_0^\top \cdot v_0$                                                                                       | $y_1 = r_1 \cdot s_1$            |
| 2   | $s_2 = \text{diag}(u) \cdot k_2^\top \cdot v_2 + k_1^\top \cdot v_1 + \text{diag}(w) \cdot k_0^\top \cdot v_0$                                             | $y_2 = r_2 \cdot s_2$            |
| 3   | $s_3 = \text{diag}(u) \cdot k_3^\top \cdot v_3 + k_2^\top \cdot v_2 + \text{diag}(w) \cdot k_1^\top \cdot v_1 + \text{diag}(w^2) \cdot k_0^\top \cdot v_0$ | $y_3 = r_3 \cdot s_3$            |
```

### Current vs. Expected behavior

- Current behavior:
With the docs’ default math setup (rehypePlugins: (v) => [rehypeKatex, ...v]), a page that contains a table with ~15–20 LaTeX formulas becomes extremely laggy and nearly unresponsive in both dev and start (production) modes.

- Expected behavior:
The page should remain responsive, with math rendering that doesn’t cause noticeable lag—even on math-heavy sections.

### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: win32
  Arch: x64
  Version: Windows 11 Home China
  Available memory (MB): 32047
  Available CPU cores: 16
Binaries:
  Node: 22.15.0
  npm: 11.3.0
  Yarn: N/A
  pnpm: 10.10.0
Relevant Packages:
  next: 16.0.10 // There is a newer version (16.1.1) available, upgrade recommended!
  eslint-config-next: N/A
  react: 19.2.0
  react-dom: 19.2.0
  typescript: 5.9.3
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
 ⚠ There is a newer version (16.1.1) available, upgrade recommended!
   Please try the latest canary version (`npm install next@canary`) to confirm the issue still exists before creating a new issue.
   Read more - https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/opening-an-issue
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Core

### Additional context

As a workaround, I set `rehype-katex` to output only MathML:

``` js
rehypePlugins: (v) => [[rehypeKatex, { output: 'mathml' }], ...v]
```

This removes the heavy HTML+MathML output that seemed to cause a DOM explosion on math-heavy tables, and the page becomes smooth again. Does this approach align with the recommended/best practice for Fumadocs, or is there a better suggested configuration for pages containing many formulas?

issues.title: `MCP` servers for `fumadocs`
issues.body:
### What problem will this feature address?

MCP servers unlock powerful capabilities — from automating coding agents to simplifying migrations and much more — making development faster and more efficient.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I think fumadocs also provides mcp servers for coding agants

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Providing mcp server is good

### Additional context

_No response_
